clinical_study.brief_title: Diagnostic and Therapeutic Applications of Microarrays in Lung Transplantation, a Multicenter Study
clinical_study.official_title: Multi-Centric Observational Study to Analyze the Diagnostic Molecular Features in the Clinical Setting of Lung Allograft Biopsies.

brief_summary.textblock: Objective: To evaluate the potential impact of molecular phenotyping of transbronchial biopsies in lung transplant recipients with allograft dysfunction, and the potential for developing a safer endobronchial mucosal biopsy format.

detailed_description.textblock: The current standard for biopsy-based diagnoses of dysfunction of lung transplants is the ISHLT classification applied to transbronchial biopsies, which represents an arbitrary international consensus. Recent data-driven approaches using molecular and conventional technologies indicate that this system produces frequently incorrect diagnoses with potential harm to patients due to inappropriate treatment. especially in relationship to the correct diagnosis of chronic lung allograft dysfunction is a pressing need. To address this unmet need and improve diagnostics in the area of organ transplantation, the Alberta Transplant Applied Genomics Centre (ATAGC, University of Alberta) has developed a new diagnostic system - the Molecular Microscope™ Diagnostic System (MMDx™) that interprets biopsies in terms of their molecular phenotype. The MMDx™, developed first in kidney transplant biopsies with well established phenotypes, will now be adapted to lung transplant transbronchial biopsies (TBBs). Microarray analysis of lung allograft biopsy specimens will be compared to conventional allograft phenotyping, including clinical, physiologic, radiographic and histological assessment. The present study will use the MMDx™ system to assess and report TBBs, and validate and refine this system in 300 unselected prospectively collected lung TBBs. A subset of the study will examine the third bifurcation mucosal endobronchial biopsies (3BMBs) paired with TBBs from 50 patients to see if the safer 3BMBs can substitute for the TBB to be used by MMDx™.

primary_outcome.measure: Assign molecular scores (probability) of lung transplant disease in a reference set of 300 transbronchial biopsies.
primary_outcome.description: Create molecular classifier that predicts antibody mediated and T cell mediated rejection, and chronic allograft dysfunction.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assign molecular scores (probability) of lung transplant disease in a reference set of 50 mucosal endobronchial biopsies.
secondary_outcome.description: Create molecular classifier that predicts antibody mediated and T cell mediated rejection, and chronic allograft dysfunction.

biospec_descr.textblock: Lung transplant biopsies taken as per local standard of care.

study_pop.textblock: Patients with functioning lung transplant biopsied to determine their graft dysfunction of to confirm good function as per standard of care.
